text: In the twelfth year of King Ahaz’s reign over Judah, Hoshea son of Elah became king over Israel. He reigned in Samaria for nine years.
He did evil in the sight of the Lord, but not to the same degree as the Israelite kings who preceded him.

<st data-num="04428" class="">King</st> <st data-num="08022" class="">Shalmaneser</st> of <st data-num="0804" class="">Assyria</st> <st data-num="05921 05927">marched up to attack</st><n id="1" /> him; so <st data-num="01954" class="">Hoshea</st> <st data-num="01961" class="">became</st> his <st data-num="05650" class="">subject</st> and <st data-num="07725" class="">paid</st> him <st data-num="04503" class="">tribute</st>.

The <st data-num="04428" class="">king</st> of <st data-num="0804" class="">Assyria</st> <st data-num="04672" class="">discovered</st> that <st data-num="01954" class="">Hoshea</st> was planning a <st data-num="07195" class="">revolt</st>.<n id="1" /> <st data-num="0834" class="">Hoshea</st> had <st data-num="07971" class="">sent</st> <st data-num="04397" class="">messengers</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> <st data-num="04428" class="">King</st> <st data-num="05471" class="">So</st><n id="2" /> of <st data-num="04714" class="">Egypt</st> and had <st data-num="03808" class="">not</st> <st data-num="05927" class="">sent</st> his <st data-num="08141 08141">annual</st> <st data-num="04503" class="">tribute</st> to the <st data-num="04428" class="">king</st> of <st data-num="0804" class="">Assyria</st>. So the <st data-num="04428" class="">king</st> of <st data-num="0804" class="">Assyria</st> <st data-num="06113" class="">arrested</st> him and <st data-num="0631 01004 03608">imprisoned</st> him.<n id="3" />

The <st data-num="04428" class="">king</st> of <st data-num="0804" class="">Assyria</st> <st data-num="05927" class="">marched</st> through<n id="1" /> the <st data-num="03605" class="">whole</st> <st data-num="0776" class="">land</st>. He <st data-num="05927" class="">attacked</st> <st data-num="08111" class="">Samaria</st> and <st data-num="06696 05921">besieged</st> it for <st data-num="07969" class="">three</st> <st data-num="08141" class="">years</st>.

In the ninth year of Hoshea’s reign, the king of Assyria captured Samaria and deported the people of Israel to Assyria. He settled them in Halah, along the Habor (the river of Gozan), and in the cities of the Medes.
This happened because the Israelites sinned against the Lord their God, who brought them up from the land of Egypt and freed them from the power of Pharaoh king of Egypt. They worshiped other gods;
they observed the practices of the nations whom the Lord had driven out from before them, and followed the example of the kings of Israel.
The Israelites said things about the Lord their God that were not right. They built high places in all their towns, from watchtower to fortified city.

They <st data-num="05324" class="">set up</st> <st data-num="04676" class="">sacred pillars</st> and <st data-num="0842" class="">Asherah poles</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">on</st> <st data-num="03605" class="">every</st> <st data-num="01364" class="">high</st> <st data-num="01389" class="">hill</st> and <st data-num="08478" class="">under</st> <st data-num="03605" class="">every</st> <st data-num="07488" class="">green</st> <st data-num="06086" class="">tree</st>.
They burned incense on all the high places just like the nations whom the Lord had driven away before them did. Their evil practices made the Lord angry.
They worshiped the disgusting idols in blatant disregard of the Lord’s command.

The Lord solemnly warned Israel and Judah through all his prophets and all the seers, “Turn back from your evil ways; obey my commandments and rules that are recorded in the law. I ordered your ancestors to keep this law and sent my servants the prophets to remind you of its demands.”
But they did not pay attention and were as stubborn as their ancestors, who had not trusted the Lord their God.

They rejected his rules, the covenant he had made with their ancestors, and the laws he had commanded them to obey. They paid allegiance to worthless idols, and so became worthless to the Lord. They copied the practices of the surrounding nations in blatant disregard of the Lord’s command.
They abandoned all the commandments of the Lord their God; they made two metal calves and an Asherah pole, bowed down to all the stars in the sky, and worshiped Baal.
They passed their sons and daughters through the fire, and practiced divination and omen reading. They committed themselves to doing evil in the sight of the Lord and made him angry.
So the Lord was furious with Israel and rejected them; only the tribe of Judah was left.
Judah also failed to keep the commandments of the Lord their God; they followed Israel’s example.
So the Lord rejected all of Israel’s descendants; he humiliated them and handed them over to robbers, until he had thrown them from his presence.
He tore Israel away from David’s dynasty, and Jeroboam son of Nebat became their king. Jeroboam drove Israel away from the Lord and encouraged them to commit a serious sin.

The <st data-num="01121 03478">Israelites</st> <st data-num="01980" class="">followed</st> in the <st data-num="03605 02403">sinful ways</st> of <st data-num="03379 0834 06213">Jeroboam</st> and did <st data-num="03808" class="">not</st> <st data-num="05493 04480">repudiate</st><n id="1" /> them.
Finally the Lord rejected Israel just as he had warned he would do through all his servants the prophets. Israel was deported from its land to Assyria and remains there to this very day.

The king of Assyria brought foreigners from Babylon, Cuthah, Avva, Hamath, and Sepharvaim and settled them in the cities of Samaria in place of the Israelites. They took possession of Samaria and lived in its cities.
When they first moved in, they did not worship the Lord. So the Lord sent lions among them and the lions were killing them.

The <st data-num="04428" class="">king</st> of <st data-num="0804" class="">Assyria</st> was <st data-num="0559 0559">told</st>,<n id="1" /> “The <st data-num="01471" class="">nations</st> <st data-num="0834" class="">whom</st> you <st data-num="01540" class="">deported</st> and <st data-num="03427" class="">settled</st> in the <st data-num="05892" class="">cities</st> of <st data-num="08111" class="">Samaria</st> do <st data-num="0369" class="">not</st> <st data-num="03045" class="">know</st> the <st data-num="04941" class="">requirements</st> of the <st data-num="0430" class="">God</st> of the <st data-num="0776" class="">land</st>, so he has <st data-num="07971" class="">sent</st> <st data-num="0738" class="">lions</st> among them. <st data-num="02009" class="">They</st> are <st data-num="04191" class="">killing</st> the people<n id="2" /> <st data-num="0834" class="">because</st> they do <st data-num="0369" class="">not</st> <st data-num="03045" class="">know</st> the <st data-num="04941" class="">requirements</st> of the <st data-num="0430" class="">God</st> of the <st data-num="0776" class="">land</st>.”

So the <st data-num="04428" class="">king</st> of <st data-num="0804" class="">Assyria</st> <st data-num="06680 0559">ordered</st>, “<st data-num="01980 08033">Take back</st> <st data-num="0259" class="">one</st> of the <st data-num="03548" class="">priests</st> <st data-num="0834" class="">whom</st> you<n id="1" /> <st data-num="01540" class="">deported</st> from <st data-num="08033" class="">there</st>. He must <st data-num="01980 03427">settle</st> <st data-num="08033" class="">there</st> and <st data-num="03384" class="">teach</st> them the <st data-num="04941" class="">requirements</st> of the <st data-num="0430" class="">God</st> of the <st data-num="0776" class="">land</st>.”<n id="2" />
So one of the priests whom they had deported from Samaria went back and settled in Bethel. He taught them how to worship the Lord.
But each of these nations made its own gods and put them in the shrines on the high places that the people of Samaria had made. Each nation did this in the cities where they lived.

The <st data-num="0376" class="">people</st> from <st data-num="0894" class="">Babylon</st> <st data-num="06213" class="">made</st> <st data-num="05524" class="">Sukkoth Benoth</st>,<n id="1" /> the <st data-num="0376" class="">people</st> from <st data-num="03575" class="">Cuth</st> <st data-num="06213" class="">made</st> <st data-num="05370" class="">Nergal</st>,<n id="2" /> the <st data-num="0376" class="">people</st> from <st data-num="02574" class="">Hamath</st> <st data-num="06213" class="">made</st> <st data-num="0807" class="">Ashima</st>,<n id="3" />

the <st data-num="05757" class="">Avvites</st> <st data-num="06213" class="">made</st> <st data-num="05026" class="">Nibhaz</st> and <st data-num="08662" class="">Tartak</st>,<n id="1" /> and the <st data-num="05616" class="">Sepharvites</st> <st data-num="08313" class="">burned</st> their <st data-num="01121" class="">sons</st> in the <st data-num="0784" class="">fire</st> as an offering to <st data-num="0152" class="">Adrammelech</st> and <st data-num="06048" class="">Anammelech</st>,<n id="2" /> the <st data-num="0433" class="">gods</st> of <st data-num="05617" class="">Sepharvaim</st>.
At the same time they worshiped the Lord. They appointed some of their own people to serve as priests in the shrines on the high places.
They were worshiping the Lord and at the same time serving their own gods in accordance with the practices of the nations from which they had been deported.

To this very day they observe their earlier practices. They do not worship the Lord; they do not obey the rules, regulations, law, and commandments that the Lord gave the descendants of Jacob, whom he renamed Israel.
The Lord made a covenant with them and instructed them, “You must not worship other gods. Do not bow down to them, serve them, or offer sacrifices to them.
Instead you must worship the Lord, who brought you up from the land of Egypt by his great power and military ability; bow down to him and offer sacrifices to him.

You must <st data-num="08104" class="">carefully</st> <st data-num="06213" class="">obey</st> at <st data-num="03605" class="">all</st> <st data-num="03117" class="">times</st> the <st data-num="02706" class="">rules</st>, <st data-num="04941" class="">regulations</st>, <st data-num="08451" class="">law</st>, and <st data-num="04687" class="">commandments</st> he <st data-num="0834 03789">wrote down</st> for you. You must <st data-num="03808" class="">not</st> <st data-num="03372" class="">worship</st> <st data-num="0312" class="">other</st> <st data-num="0430" class="">gods</st>.

You must <st data-num="03808" class="">never</st> <st data-num="07911" class="">forget</st> the <st data-num="01285 0834">covenant</st> I <st data-num="03772" class="">made</st> <st data-num="0854" class="">with</st> you, and you must <st data-num="03808" class="">not</st> <st data-num="03372" class="">worship</st> <st data-num="0312" class="">other</st> <st data-num="0430" class="">gods</st>.
Instead you must worship the Lord your God; then he will rescue you from the power of all your enemies.”

But they<n id="1" /> <st data-num="08085" class="">paid</st> <st data-num="03808" class="">no</st> <st data-num="08085" class="">attention</st>; <st data-num="03588 0518">instead</st> <st data-num="01992" class="">they</st> <st data-num="06213" class="">observed</st> their <st data-num="07223" class="">earlier</st> <st data-num="04941" class="">practices</st>.
These nations were worshiping the Lord and at the same time serving their idols; their sons and grandsons are doing just as their fathers have done, to this very day.
